config.question: Which of the following children is displaying development of gross motor skills typical of a 4-year-old?

choices.content: Angela can jump several times and keep her balance, as long as she uses two feet.
Mikhail can dodge obstacles by taking a long, running jump while holding a football to score touchdowns for his team.
Nadia can hold a fork in one hand and a knife in the other and cut her own food.
Hector can alternate his feet to walk down the long staircase in his school while holding on to the handrail.

answer_3.response: Consider this: At age 4, most children can control their ability to stop, start, and turn; jump a distance of 24–33 inches; descend a long stairway by alternating feet; and hop 4 to 6 steps on one foot. LO 4.3 How does motor development evolve in preschool children?
